item.title: Black Forest Cake II
item.description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Perfectly moist and rich, it’s a show-stopping dessert that brings a touch of elegance and nostalgia to any celebration.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 70 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup shortening
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
  • 1/2 cup kirschwasser (cherry brandy)
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon strong brewed coffee
  • 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
  • 2 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon kirschwasser
  • 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
  2. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt; set aside.
  3. Cream shortening and sugar together until light and fluffy.
  4. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
  5. Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
  6. Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
  7. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
  9. Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to create 4 layers total.
  10. Sprinkle each layer generously with 1/2 cup kirschwasser to soak.
  11. In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
  12. Add confectioners' sugar, a pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
  13. Spread one-third of the buttercream filling on the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries. Repeat for remaining layers.
  14. In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
  15. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
  16. Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
  17. Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake as garnish.

📌 Pinterest Tags: #cat1758062855567 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie #homemade #delicious #allpurpose #unsweetened #baking

item.title: Black Forest Cake II
item.description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet cherry filling and fluffy whipped cream. Its rich, moist texture combined with the bright cherry notes makes it a show-stopping dessert perfect for any celebration.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 30 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 70 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup shortening
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
  • 1/2 cup kirschwasser (cherry liqueur)
  • 1/2 cup butter
  • 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 teaspoon strong brewed coffee
  • 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
  • 2 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 tablespoon kirschwasser
  • 1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
  2. Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
  3. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy using a mixer.
  4. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until well combined.
  5. Alternately beat in the flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
  6. Divide batter evenly between the two prepared pans and smooth tops.
  7. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Cool cakes completely in pans, then remove parchment paper.
  9. Cut each cake layer horizontally in half to create four layers total.
  10. Sprinkle each layer generously with 1/2 cup kirschwasser to soak.
  11. In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy.
  12. Add confectioners' sugar, pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a few teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
  13. Spread one-third of the buttercream filling over the first cake layer.
  14. Top filling with one-third of the drained Bing cherries.
  15. Repeat spreading filling and cherries on the next two layers.
  16. In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks.
  17. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
  18. Frost the top and sides of the assembled cake with the whipped cream mixture.
  19. Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate square and sprinkle over the cake for garnish.
